performances.description: from DP15..rules hard.
A barnburner from start to finish...everything is clicking...nicely segues into Big River
Aggressive and heartfelt

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Super Flowing and awesome
Kickass opening tune as a sign of the greatness to come on this night
Absolutely sick build up immediately after the rio grandeo lyrics

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Thrilling peak, this one is the goods
Surprised this one is not listed, a great year for Half-Step, this one is worth a listen, a good version.
KEITH!
Just excatly right.

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Fairgrounds Arena Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Dick's Picks 19 version.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Globs of catharsis
Sharp vocals + tight band = great music!
Very nice version
Jerry rocks this one out!

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Some sick keys work by Keith in a really great version from DP 1
Another fabulous version, the ending is so tender and emotional.
Jerry = ON
FLAWLESS!!!!!  there are only a handful of GD performances that are truly worthy of that stamp, and this is the top of the top.  just exactly perfect.
Absolutely rockin' version.  Mellow vocals to screaming peaks. Killer show opener!!
Dark Star->Eyes->Half Step.
Awesome mellow version
One of my favorite 80s 1st sets.  This version here is not the on and on type, but it is so well-played, everyone is on it!
A monster version!
Jerry Rocks pre-post "rio grandeo" segment
April fools '88! Very fun and rocking Mississippi Half Step. Note the band jamming 'little bunny foo-foo' before they go into it
Butter (Yes the "Without A Net" Version) BEST!
Great version! The one on Dick's Picks Volume 7.
Surprised this hasn't made the list.  Jerry rocks it out at the end of this early version!
ESSENTIAL Dead material here.
A "do not miss" show.
this was an incredible run of shows...second set half step
Jerry just attacks this one (vocally too) right from the outset. I love summer '89.
Has that great 76 chill feel to it.  Different than 77, but has its own beauty with great Garcia work.
Thunderous...one of my favorite recordings because it gives the feeling of being there.
A Homo erectus-like version but notable for Jerry's solo after the first Rio Grandee chorus.
A strong version.
Hard-swingin' version with lots of oomph behind it.  Sweet show.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Astonishingly strong Jerry vocals, especially given the year, and some of the prettiest Hornsby-led fills make this one a real great sleeper pick.
Phil Bombs, climactic build up, gospel sing along. Wonderful!
Very Very Nice Version!!!
stranger>half step>weight
Just exactly perfect...sooooo beautiful as they fade into "across the rio grand-eo"
Jerry's solos groove with this great Foxtrot Ballroom melody and the band just swings along with him. So Perfect!!

performances.venue: Indianapolis State Fair Coliseum Indianapolis, IN
performances.description: Another fantastic run of Playing->Half-Step->Big River->Playing.
Great high-energy show opener.  30-31 March '73 often overlooked.  Give a listen and you wont regret it.
A brezzy show opener, lots of beauty here

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA

performances.description: i've never heard Jerry wail quite like this, and Brent's form doesn't seem like something humanly possible, punches every key. Also-crowd energy!
Hot Half-Step->Franklin's

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA

performances.description: Listen past some sound quality problems for a sweet, thoughtful version - especially the outro.
This is a big boy version excellent
Jerry ate a frog before the show but they are in the pocket on this one.  Phil came out this night and gave us the Hiya Hiya Hiya kids...
Describing the headiness of this tune is a daunting task. Show opener. Lyrically tight, with Jerry sending us on a mystical journey.
How has this not been submitted yet? Listening to the Hunter Matrix just released from 2020. Listen to this with headphones.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.description: This has some bounce to it and just digin' the era's tone.
Sloppy start but the rest is played well. Not as good as many 77 versions but it deserves a mention.
More Bounce to the Ounce
this whole show is worthy
Sometimes I can't come up with the words...this is one of those times
A very tight reading of this classic before they change the arragement with the acros the rio grande coda. Garica at has twangy best.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Real nice 80's version.

performances.venue: Des Moines Civic Center Des Moines, IA
performances.description: 2nd Set opener check the sbd for this to get full effect > Franklin's
They're feeling it...in that '72 style.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: second night opener cant go wrong with half step
Half Step->Roses...wonderfully executed and captured nicely w/ an AUD recording...Wall of Sound
Second Set Opener 1/2 Step-> I Know You Rider

performances.venue: Robertson Gym, UC Santa Barbara Goleta, CA
performances.description: I can't believe I've missed out on this show for so long. Jerry seems to be trying to top Bobs Good Lovin'. The band is clicking.
A fantastic run of Playing->Half-Step->Big River->Playing.

performances.venue: Assembly Hall, University Of Illinois Champaign, IL
performances.description: First Half Step of '73 and they get it perfect.  A hidden gem in an often-overlooked show.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Pre rio grandeo is good, but there are two peaks post rio grandeo, one built off the other and the latter crashes into Franklin's Tower.
This version is tight. Nice pre-Rio Grande grove and super solid outro.  Great tone for Jer and Keith is great.
Steady rockin' version with beautiful outro.

performances.venue: McGaw Memorial Hall - Northwestern University Evanston, IL
performances.description: Sweet and subtle, part of a mega-massive 2nd set jam.  A beauty.
Summer '90 style musical performance of 1/2 step.
Great example of how the Dead hit another hot streak in '89, what a tremendous opener. Jerry and Phil belt out the vocals
Jerry spaces on the lyrics, but the jamming is not to be missed.
Surprised not to find this.
One of the best. Kicks off to a great start with Phil dropping bombs, Jerry's singing at its best.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: This one swings and sways as it should... (source:CM)
Half Step in MS - you decide.
Came for the Dancin'
lots of phil
deal>half step to open set 2
Nice groovy outro.  Great show, good vibes.
Nice soloing and a powerful conclusion.

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: The boys seem to love playing in unanounced, unstructred jams like this.  Freedom reminiscent of some '67-69's but with the '73 songlist.
Early '73, classic
This one's a treat for '86 - buoyant and high energy
thoughtful and airy just how I like these this one pays off beautifully.
Jam out of final chorus plays like waves crashing on the beach....
Crazy '78 version

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Solid version for 87. Brent makes this. Jerry and brent are right with eachother esp before the rio grande.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: second set opener sets tone for unbelievable set
I wish there was a soundboard of this.
Stunned this wasn't posted earlier. Superb 1/2 step opener, Garcia plays melodically and beautifully.

performances.venue: Rutgers Athletic Center New Brunswick, NJ

performances.description: Nice opener with Bruce on Grand Piano.
awesome show at the rocks

performances.venue: Folsom Field, University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: Extremelly fun early performance of Half step. Jerry has a real cool bounce to his playing. His solos are VERY tasty on this GEM.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Fantastic Mississippi Half Step
Super chill Rio Grandeo into a  blissed out wind down.
Impassioned rendition from a monster show.
Great opener along with the Franklin's. Jerry has some hot licks in this one.
they saved it for the end of the tour.  w/hornsby on accordian
A cool set two opening of Space->Half-Step->Franklin's.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: A nice Half-Step->Franklin's.

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC

performances.description: One of the best. Kicks off to a great start with Phil dropping bombs, Jerry's singing at its best.
THEY NAIL IT. Magical version for the '90's.
Jerry channels George Harrison like nobody's business. The solo at 2:45 gently weeps, guys. Check it out.
Jerry nails it, but Phil sounds awful and he's loud in the mix.
the only maxwell XL-II I ever wore out
Welcome back, Bruce
Very sweet smooth version!
Good one

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Solid!

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: jerry blows some lyrics but a beautiful long bridge leads to a great ending...across the rio grande-O
1st step in a couple of years, keeps going and going and going one of the better ones ever.
Great version from a great show!
A cool upbeat version.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Strong performance. Played with pride. The band locked in tight.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.description: A flubbed line early on but great playing!
Early, very tight version. August '72, so you know its well worthy of a listen. Stellar rendition
Gorgeous well rehearsed tight early performance of the evetual classic. Jerry and Bobby sound like they are having a blast.
The 1/2 Step into Dew is truly GD magic at its best. Jerry just nails it, really fantastic
Show opener at Laguna Seca - twas a beautiful day...and the boys came to play. Check the CM source.
An early Brent Mydland Half Step with electric piano pre rio grandeo and a joyful Garcia solo afterwards.
The final Keith and Donna Half Step stands up well, even though there's one lonely AUD.
Loose in places, but full of joy.
The last halfstep of '76. After Rio Grandeo everyone including the crowd gets into it. The source is a B+ AUD.
A solid, sweet rocker.  Seems like MHUT had matured in '72 by this point to the stand-alone anchor that it remained until the end.
Great first set opener from a good show from somewhat underrated year. Jerry is really 'on' here, and his solos and vocals are both excellent!
GD Magic this night in Boston....extreme band and crowd mind meld proven on the Wiley Aud.
Solid later year version.  Jerry is dialed in and vocals and guitar are on point
Show opener and Jerry is having some fun.
Jerry Hitting a mean solo in this one, just makes you want to dance!
Obviously not as epic as any of the '77 behemoths, but pretty damn sweet for an early version
What is this, chopped liver?
Grand-eo
Nice version. Soulful lead playing by Garcia
Little jumbled at first but breaks out into a superb solo pre-Rio Grandio
Not long or jammed to the hilt, but Jerry sounds really good here. Enjoyable version.
This show gets a lot of attention for other songs - surprised to not see the Half Step listed, as it is excellent
Jerry's voice is haggard, but the playing really makes up for it!
Whoever has the board of this, please release it.
Cool set 2 opener, bouncy and fun. moves nicely into LL rain.
Fun hot and playful Mississippi Half Step->Feel Like a Stranger->Franklin's Tower what a hot way to open up a real good show.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: swinging and fun opener from MSG, Phil thumping from the outset  tight fall 93 show
There is some magic post rio grandeo.
Although only part of set 2 seems to exist, great show. Clean,good energy,starting to get that fall 73 jazziness.
Uptempo, and with a hard swagger, with a beaut of a Rio section. 2nd ever, sounds like they're still settling on the vibe.
Sharp and clear as a bell.

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Starts off a killer first set.  Top notch pre and post rio Grande jams.
Solid show opener
Slow version, takes time to warm up. Sometimes the slow shuffle brings out the most emotion.
No high peaks but JG's playing is just fluttering in the wind.
Beautiful full band build

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl, U.N.L.V. Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: jer bear sings this one beautifully
Whole band on the same wavelength. Jerry, Bobby, Vince, and Bruce all add flair in a wonderful version!

performances.venue: Irvine Meadows Amphitheatre Laguna Hills, CA

performances.description: jerry
a real nice guy
Not too polished yet, but full of that new-song exhuberence. Great key work from Keith, and a funforall Reeeee-o Grand outro.
Short Rio Grandeo but Jer spanks the outro with extra spicy mustard...check the Glassberg.
Not the best but pretty damn good for 86.
Sweet half-step, Jerry with Tiger, what more could you ask for?
Mid-80s gets overlooked, check it out
Opener, solid ‘80s version

performances.venue: Great Western LA Forum Inglewood, CA
performances.description: Show opener. Phantastic Phil! Jerry does his thing.
I haven't seen this one listed but I haven't heard a better one yet. Jerry is on fire at the end with rapid fire playing that makes the crowd go nuts.

performances.venue: California State University Dominguez Hills Carson, CA
performances.description: Half Step opener, yes !
Rough beginning, but gets progressively better

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: When Jerry was on in this era it was phenomenal the way he had feeling and dynamics in the touch of the pick
Plenty hot... got that x factor on this tour for sure, crackling and locking like puzzle pieces
Hot jack straw left right upper cut with seasoned gossamer texture
nice florida love, devils circus
gliding, bouncy, breezy, athletic, inspired.
Terrific 72 version w/ Across the Rio Grandee-o

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Big and great
Incredible version.  Insane bobby licks. Slick as anything. Followed by rockin roadrunner, listen to an aud
